author: axic3354
content: Potentially unpopular question, but is the warm coinbase worth it? (I personally brought the question up months ago, why isn't it warm, but is the change worth it?)

author: sky.cactus
content: I think everyone agrees on that.

author: axic3354
content: Should have been, but is the change complexity worth it?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: It benefits mev people, so I'm against it :D

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We could say the same thing about push0

author: axic3354
content: I think that's a bad example, `push0` is an addition and not rule change üôÇ

author: axic3354
content: I have nothing against the warm coinbase as after-the-change it the spec will be more clear, just that it adds another if/else to the ruleset.

author: timbeiko
content:
Quick summary of the call for those who couldn't make it, given we covered a lot today üòÖ !

With regards to the Shanghai implementations, we agreed to include the following EIPs in Shanghai and launch a devnet with them ASAP: 

EIP-3651: Warm COINBASE
EIP-3855: PUSH0 instruction
EIP-3860: Limit and meter initcode
EIP-4895: Beacon chain push withdrawals as operations

We also agreed to keep working on EOF and 4844-specific devnets in parallel, and have them build on top of this "Shanghai Core" devnet, to mirror how the CL teams are having 4844 rebased on top of Capella (which is mostly withdrawals). 

We also discussed potentially including EIP-4758, which deactivates SELFDESTRUCT, but agreed there needs to be more analysis done here. 

Next Tuesday 15:00 UTC there will be a community call about outstanding Goerli supply issues: https://github.com/eth-clients/goerli/issues/129

author: timbeiko
content: PR moving the EIPs to Included - will merge in the next day or so unless there's an objection: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/633

author: timbeiko
content: Should we organize an EOF breakout call to dive into this more next week?
